Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc31
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc31.view.gui.controllers

Class InGameController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc31.view.gui.controllers.ViewController
it.polimi.ingsw.gc31.view.gui.controllers.InGameController
public class InGameController extends ViewController
Contains all the game view logic and provide the player with all the controls necessary to play the game

    void
    updateChat(String fromUsername, String toUsername, String message)
    Transform the prefix of the received message in [From: fromUsername"]: or [To: "toUsername"]: based on the client username or ignores the message if he is not involved then calls populate chat to show the message log correctly
    private void
    updateGrid(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane grid, Map<javafx.util.Pair<Integer,Integer>,InGameController.Cell> cells, Map<Point,PlayableCard> playArea)
    Start with checking if the specified grid had to be resized, then set all the cells of the relative grid to the invisible image and finally set the image of the cards in the playArea to the cells in the grid.
    private void
    updateHand(int playerNumber, List<PlayableCard> hand)
    Updates the visual representation of a player's hand by setting the card images for the specified player Iterates through the list of playable cards and updates the corresponding image in the player's hand. If the player's hand contains only two cards, it sets a placeholder image for the Third card slot.
    private void
    updateResources(int playerNumber, Map<Resources,Integer> achievedResources)
    Updates the visual representation of a player's resources by setting the resource labels for the specified player.

    • show_goldDeck

      public void show_goldDeck(PlayableCard firstCardDeck, PlayableCard card1, PlayableCard card2)
      Description copied from class: ViewController
      Method implemented in the InGameController only Updates the UI to display the top cards of the gold deck.

      This method sets the images of the provided PlayableCard objects to their corresponding UI components for the gold deck. Specifically, it sets the image of the first card in the deck and two other cards from the gold deck.

      Overrides:
      show_goldDeck in class ViewController
      Parameters:
      firstCardDeck - The top card of the gold deck to be displayed.
      card1 - The first card from the gold deck to be displayed.
      card2 - The second card from the gold deck to be displayed.

    • updateChat

      public void updateChat(String username, String message)
      Description copied from class: ViewController
      Method called by the server. Transform the prefix in "username: " then calls populate chat to show the message log correctly
      Overrides:
      updateChat in class ViewController
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player that sent the message.
      message - The message.

    • updateChat

      public void updateChat(String fromUsername, String toUsername, String message)
      Description copied from class: ViewController
      Transform the prefix of the received message in [From: fromUsername"]: or [To: "toUsername"]: based on the client username or ignores the message if he is not involved then calls populate chat to show the message log correctly
      Overrides:
      updateChat in class ViewController
      Parameters:
      fromUsername - The username of the player that sent the message.
      toUsername - The username of the player that will receive the message.
      message - The message.

    • quit

      public void quit()
      Handles the quitting process for a player, displaying a confirmation dialog and performing necessary actions if confirmed. Displays a confirmation alert to the player asking if they are sure they want to quit the game. If the player confirms, attempts to quit the game and navigates back to the main menu. Handles potential remote exceptions by showing a server crash warning.

    • addColumn

      private void addColumn(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane grid, Map<javafx.util.Pair<Integer,Integer>,InGameController.Cell> cells, int x)
      Adds a column to the specified GridPane at the specified x-coordinate and fills it with cells. Notice that it need to specify what cells map to use.
      Parameters:
      grid - The GridPane to which the column is to be added.
      x - The x-coordinate of the new column.

    • addRow

      Parameters:

      y - The y-coordinate of the new row.

    • updateGrid

      private void updateGrid(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane grid, Map<javafx.util.Pair<Integer,Integer>,InGameController.Cell> cells, Map<Point,PlayableCard> playArea)
      Start with checking if the specified grid had to be resized, then set all the cells of the relative grid to the invisible image and finally set the image of the cards in the playArea to the cells in the grid.
      Parameters:
      grid - The GridPane to be updated.
      playArea - The map representing the play area.

    • updateResources

      private void updateResources(int playerNumber, Map<Resources,Integer> achievedResources)
      Updates the visual representation of a player's resources by setting the resource labels for the specified player.
    • Iterates through the map of achieved resources and updates the corresponding resource label based on the resource type.
    • Sets the text of each resource label to reflect the current amount of the resource.
      • Parameters:
      playerNumber - The number of the player whose resources are being updated.
      achievedResources - A map containing the resources and their corresponding amounts that the player has achieved.

    • updateHand

      private void updateHand(int playerNumber, List<PlayableCard> hand)
      Updates the visual representation of a player's hand by setting the card images for the specified player
    • Iterates through the list of playable cards and updates the corresponding image in the player's hand.
    • If the player's hand contains only two cards, it sets a placeholder image for the Third card slot.
      • Parameters:
      playerNumber - The number of the player whose hand is being updated.
      hand - A list of playable cards representing the player's current hand.

    • changeGridResolution

      private void changeGridResolution(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane grid, Map<javafx.util.Pair<Integer,Integer>,InGameController.Cell> cells)
      Support method to change resolution to one single GridPane

      private void hideHand(List<PlayableCard> hand)

    • setClipToImageView

      private void setClipToImageView(javafx.scene.image.ImageView target)
      Set the clip of the target ImageView to a rectangle with rounded corners. Basically used to round the corners of the cards. Change here to modify the shape of the cards.

    • addHandCardDragListener

      private void addHandCardDragListener(javafx.scene.image.ImageView card)
      Adds a drag listener to the specified (ImageView) handCard. When a drag is detected, the motherPane is locked to the current size and the card is dragged. Then a snapshot of the card is taken and added to the dragBoard. This is done because of a bug that resize the outer pane when a snapshot is taken. The motherPane is then set to resizable again.
      Parameters:
      card - The ImageView to which the drag listener is to be added.

    • resizeCard

      private void resizeCard(javafx.scene.image.ImageView card)
      Resizes a card's image view to fit specified dimensions and sets a clipping region to ensure the image is displayed correctly.
    • Sets the fit height and width of the card image view based on predefined size values.
    • Applies a clipping region to the card image view to ensure the image is properly displayed within the set dimensions.
      • Parameters:
      card - The ImageView representing the card to be resized.

    • lockMotherPaneSize

      private void lockMotherPaneSize()
      Locks the size of the mother pane to its current dimensions, preventing it from being resized. Used to prevent a little visual bug during drag and drop.

    • setMotherPaneResizable

      private void setMotherPaneResizable()
      Unlocks the size of the mother pane to its current dimensions, allowing it to be resizable. Used to prevent a little visual bug during drag and drop.

    • showHidePane

      private void showHidePane(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)
      Supportive method used to hide or show a Pane
      Parameters:
      pane - generic Pane to hid or show

    • assignPion

      private void assignPion()
      Assigns a pion image to each player based on their name and updates the corresponding image view.

      This method performs the following steps:

      1. Creates a list of pion image paths.
      2. Iterates through the list of players and assigns the corresponding pion image to each player's image view based on their name.

    • populateChat

      private void populateChat(String username, String message, javafx.scene.text.Text usernameText)
      Populates the TextFlow, adding the prefix colored in a uniquely color and the message (suffix + \n) Then proceed to layout the new message among the others using the scrollPane Also shows the notification icon is the chat is closed at the moment
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player used to assign the color to the message prefix
      message - The message content to be added to the chat.
      usernameText - The prefix of the message already modified

    • formatTime

      private String formatTime(int seconds)
